title: Baked Red Snapper
summary: Baked Red Snapper requires approximately 30 minutes from start to finish. This recipe makes 1 servings with 1121 calories, 189g of protein, and 27g of fat each. For $15.33 per serving, this recipe covers 54% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe from Recipezaar has 1 fans. It works well as a pricey main course. If you have snapper fillets, olive oil, onion, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. Overall, this recipe earns an excellent spoonacular score of 84%. Similar recipes include Red Snapper, Shrimp, and Watermelon Ceviche, Baked Red Snapper, and Baked Red Snapper with Avgolemono.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. One wine you could try is Rabble Pinot Gris. It has 4.9 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 20 dollars.

productMatches.title: Rabble Pinot Gris
productMatches.description: Alsatian-inspired with notes of lime, green apple, white flower and wetstone. Following the nose are flavors of Anjou pear, white nectarine andcitrus. The vibrant and crisp acidity balances out this medium bodied wineand carries it through the lingering finish.

instructions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees.Brush pan with 1 teaspoon olive oil.Brush fish with the rest of the olive oil.Top with the veggies.Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes.This is also very good on the grill in a foil packet.

steps.step: Brush pan with 1 teaspoon olive oil.
Brush fish with the rest of the olive oil.Top with the veggies.Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes.This is also very good on the grill in a foil packet.
